definition: Having or showing an exaggerated sense of one’s own importance; overly proud.
examples: He sounded arrogant when he dismissed the question.
An arrogant attitude can push friends away.

extra.memory_tip: Arrogant = acting like you’re above others.

definition: To refuse to buy, use, or take part in something as a form of protest; the act of refusing.
examples: Customers boycotted the brand over its policy. (verb)
The boycott lasted for three months. (noun)

definition: A planned series of actions to reach a goal; to work in an organised way toward a goal.
examples: They launched a campaign to clean the river. (noun)
Students campaigned for safer crossings. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Campaign = many steps for one aim.

definition: A formal event or set of actions done on a special occasion.
examples: The award ceremony starts at noon.
They held a ceremony to open the bridge.

extra.memory_tip: Ceremony = set steps for a special moment.

definition: The care or keeping of someone or something; legal right to look after a child; the state of being kept by police.
examples: The artefacts are in the museum’s custody.
The suspect remained in police custody.

definition: To treat someone with disrespect; to make something worse or of lower quality; to break down naturally.
examples: We must not degrade others with insults.
Some plastics degrade slowly in nature.

definition: To keep someone from leaving; to hold someone in official custody.
examples: Security detained the trespasser.
Fog detained several flights.

definition: To make longer or larger; to offer; to continue for a longer time.
examples: They extended the deadline by a week.
Please extend a warm welcome to our guests.

definition: To combine parts into a whole; to include people equally in a group or place.
examples: The new software integrates with email.
Schools worked to integrate students from all backgrounds.

extra.memory_tip: Integrate = make it integral to the whole.

definition: To keep people or things apart, often in a way that is unfair.
examples: Laws once segregated schools by race.
Please don’t segregate classmates during games.

definition: Highest in rank, power, or quality; very great.
examples: Safety is of supreme importance.
They made a supreme effort to finish on time.

definition: A great victory or success; to win or succeed greatly.
examples: The project was a triumph for the team. (noun)
They triumphed after months of practice. (verb)

definition: To leave a place or give up a position.
examples: Please vacate the room by noon.
She will vacate the post at the end of term.

definition: A decision made by a jury or judge; any final decision about something.
examples: The jury returned a unanimous verdict.
What’s your verdict on the new menu?

definition: To break a rule or law; to treat with disrespect; to disturb or harm.
examples: Parking here would violate the rules.
Loud noise can violate the peace of the library.
